pros: Good environment and working culture
cons: bad salary for student workers

review_title: Constant lies from president and top administration
pros: Lots of good people who care about students.
cons: Tiny town. I loved that but it's a con for most. The administration spins everything to the point of flat out falsehoods and lies. It's a horrible and toxic environment reminiscent of abusive relationships. There are crazy decisions being made all the time with many positions having no match in a standard higher education setting or vague titles or odd jumbled responsibilities.

job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Lamoni, IA
pros: There are truly some great people at university and around the town.
cons: Upper administration don't care for the employees, they have hidden agendas that many see and speak about.

pros: The campus is beautiful in the summer. The town has a nice bike path. The students are wonderful, brilliant, and kind.
cons:
Administration has no respect for faculty, staff, and students. This is displayed in their blatant disregard for procedures, contracts, and morals. Additionally, their constant gaslighting and manipulation creates a toxic environment of ambiguity. No one is safe from the wrath of Pres. Draves. 

This institution used to be a loving and close-knit community. Faculty felt supported and morale was high. Since faculty and departments are pitted against each other, it is an incredibly fragile balance to tread. There is no longer trust amongst colleagues. 

As stated, admin have zero respect for students. No concern for the safety and well-being of the students. Known title 9 violations are not dealt with. Rather than providing justice for victims, admin opts to silence the issue to protect the image. 

Additionally, Admin doesn't prioritize quality education. This is apparent in the high faculty turn over. While many leave to escape the school, many also ' leave' because they weren't deemed submissive enough. They opt to replace and replace and replace quality professors to find someone who is easy to manipulate and who aren't 'in it' for the future of the students. 

Finally, nepotism should be Graceland's motto. That is how the school operates. To have a chance at a successful future at GU, you must be connected to very important/influential Graceland-ers. Usually this occurs by some relationship- marriage, donor relative, past roommate/best friend, married to the president. If you don't have those connections, chances are you won't last long or you'll constantly feel as if you are disconnected, isolated, and unwelcome.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Lamoni, IA
pros: Working as a writing center tutor at Graceland was an amazing experience and opportunity. It helped me grow as a writer and tutor to continue helping other students.
cons: I had no issues with this job.

pros: Low cost of living in Lamoni
cons: No room for growth and no job security.

review_title: Great People and Community, Horrible Admin
pros: The people who I worked with were amazing and lovely. There is a really great sense of community there.
cons: The administration do not care about faculty and there was a lot of mismanagement.

job_title: Customer Service in Los Angeles, CA
pros: Graceland University was very flexible.
cons: I can't think of any cons.

pros: None at all. U get holiday pay
cons: No teamwork, management only looked out for themselves, no structure. Theft unreliable

pros: Low stress work place with plenty of time on your hand to work on your projects.
cons: The pay is low and so are the funding. Majority of the staffers or faculty are people who graduated from Graceland and are working here because they live in Lamoni. Therefore majority of the employees are people who can get the job done but not good at what they do. The insurance is pretty pathetic too. If you are a recent grad looking for a place to start working, my suggestion would be look for a proper school.

review_title: Great Colleagues, Bad Location and Administration
pros:
I love my colleagues and for the most part, my students
There is a lot of freedom and flexibility in the position, get to develop classes you are interested in
cons:
Unless you like small towns, the location isn't great
The administration is kind of a mess and the pay isn't great

pros: Great colleagues who help and guide you as you grow.  Some of the upper administration is willing to bend over backwards for their faculty.
cons: Salaries are not where they need to be, but they are working towards improvement.  Location is tough, it is in south central Iowa.
